action.action-desc: Miss Rice of New York (for herself and Mr. Krishnamoorthi) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Transportation to establish a distracted driving education grant program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Distracted Driving Education Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Not later than October 1, 2018, the Secretary of Transportation shall establish a distracted driving education grant program.
In carrying out the program established under subsection (a), the Secretary may make a grant, on a competitive basis, to a nonprofit organization.

A grant made under subsection (b) shall be used to provide education to the public regarding the risks of distracted driving, including texting or otherwise using a personal wireless communications device while driving.

To be eligible for a grant made under subsection (b), a nonprofit organization shall submit to the Secretary an application in such form, at such time, and containing such information as the Secretary determines appropriate.
There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to make grants under subsection (b) $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 and 2020.
